com.garmin.health

Interface CoreDevice

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Device

    public interface CoreDevice
    Represents a physical device.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String address()
      Returns the MAC address of the device.
      <any> batteryPercentage()
      Returns future for a percentage as an integer or -1 if battery life not available.
      SupportStatus batteryPercentageSupportStatus()
      Check the support for on demand battery percentage.
      ConnectionState connectionState()
      Returns the current connection state of the device.
      SupportStatus connectIqLaunchSupportStatus()
      Check the support for launching connect IQ apps remotely.
      SupportStatus dataLoggingSupportStatus()
      Check the support for data logging.
      int firmwareVersion()
      Returns device firmware version as in integer in the form XXX = X.XX
      String friendlyName()
      Returns the model name of the device, suitable for display, e.g.
      <any> getLaunchableConnectIqApps()
      Returns a future wrapping list of Connect IQ apps that are available to be launched remotely.
      int image()
      Returns an id referencing a PNG image with transparent background.
      <any> launchConnectIqApp(ConnectIqItem connectIqItem)
      Attempt to launch a Connect IQ App remotely.
      DeviceModel model()
      Returns this device's model
      SupportStatus notificationSupportStatus()
      Whether device supports showing notifications.
      SetupState setupState()
      Return the state of post-pairing setup.
      Set<DataSource> supportedLoggingTypes()
      Returns a set of supported logging types, or null if no types are supported.
      long unitId()
      Returns the unit id.

        Return the state of post-pairing setup.

        Check the support for on demand battery percentage.
        Returns:
        Support status representing the current state of this feature.

        Returns future for a percentage as an integer or -1 if battery life not available.

      • notificationSupportStatus

        SupportStatus notificationSupportStatus()
        Whether device supports showing notifications. If supported.

      • connectIqLaunchSupportStatus

        SupportStatus connectIqLaunchSupportStatus()
        Check the support for launching connect IQ apps remotely.
        Returns:
        Support status representing the current state of this feature.

      • getLaunchableConnectIqApps

        <any> getLaunchableConnectIqApps()
        Returns a future wrapping list of Connect IQ apps that are available to be launched remotely.
        Returns:
        A list of connect iq items.

      • launchConnectIqApp

        <any> launchConnectIqApp(ConnectIqItem connectIqItem)
        Attempt to launch a Connect IQ App remotely.
        Parameters:
        connectIqItem - the connect iq item to be launched.
        Returns:
        a future set to true if app launch was sent, false if it failed for any reason.

      • dataLoggingSupportStatus

        SupportStatus dataLoggingSupportStatus()
        Check the support for data logging.
        Returns:
        Support status representing known state of this feature.

      • supportedLoggingTypes

        Set<DataSource> supportedLoggingTypes()
        Returns a set of supported logging types, or null if no types are supported.
        Returns:
        a set of all data sources supported y this device.
